CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper July 13, 1946, pg. 5, reads: "At the Bottom Again - Because he has only four years to go for his pension after piloting engines in Union Railroad yards for forty-six years, 'Jim' Anthony, oldest employe [employee] of Union Railroad took this job firing a stationary boiler until results of Federal suit can determine whether employes with less experience belonging to the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers can legally take the jobs of CIO Steelworkers Union Roadhouse Engineers. A National Railway Mediation Board ruling recently gave Railway Brotherhoods jurisdiction over the roundhouse engineers' jobs - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: "Jim Anthony shoveling coal into stationary boiler
